intro: Commelina irumuensis, commonly known as the Irumu Commelina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes a variety of grass-like and herbaceous plants. The plant features slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typically displaying white or pale blue petals. Commelina irumuensis is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments, making it a common sight in forest understories.
